title: Natural Language Inference: for humans and machines
author: Valeria de Paiva
description: A talk about inference in Natural Language

title: Dialectica Petri Nets
author: Valeria de Paiva
description: This talk describes Dialectica Petri Nets, suggested by Carolyn Brown. These nets allow for very different labels on edges.

title: Dialectica e os Problemas de Kolmogorov-Veloso
author: Valeria de Paiva

title: Going Without: A Linear Modality and FP
author: Valeria de Paiva
description: A talk on MSFP on modal types.

author: Sara Negri
description: A talk on Glivenko-style results: results for which classical provability yields intuitionistic provability.

title: Lessons from failing distributive laws
author: Maaike Zwart
description: A talk about the tricky business of composing monads via distributive laws.

title: Randomness and computability theory
author: Johanna Franklin
description: A talk about how computability provides us with a framework for formalizing our intuitions about randomness.

title: The New Era of Formalised Mathematics and the ALEXANDRIA Project
author: Angeliki Koutsoukou Argyraki
description: A talk about the formalisation of mathematics with proof assistants, especially Isabelle.

title: From Computers to Diagrams and Back
author: Gisele Secco
description: A talk about the philosophical aspects of the  formalisation of the 4-color theorem.
